Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from five fragments) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery bowl; interior black with two red bands lined in white; exterior: cream slip; springing goat to right, head turned back; large floral ornament to right; ; filling ornaments: quatrefoils, dotted circles, pendant roundels; below, three bands above rays on lower wall.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the decorative pattern, see Cambridge NA36.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.242, no.3)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VIII, no. 11)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 50)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.226)
